formalpara.title: Figure 12. Illustration of the Central Limit Theorem for binomial proportions.
formalpara.para: Panels A–D show results from a computational sampling experiment where the proportion of successes in the population is 0.25. The x axes indicate the proportions obtained from samples sizes of 10, 20, 40, and 80. The y axes indicate the number of computational samples obtained for a given proportion. As expected, larger-sized samples give distributions that are closer to normal in shape and have a narrower range of values.
